Body: Possible Duplicate:  Should apps take up any internal storage when installed to SD?  I have a Samsung Galaxy Ace. I have recently rooted my phone and now I can move the apps to the SD card, however it does not seem to work the way I expected. When I move the app to the sd card, some footprint of the app still remain on the internal memory. For example, recently I downloaded an app which took up 5MB of storage space. After moving it to the SD card, it still appears to use 3MB of space on my internal storage. Is it possible to move the app completely to the SD card?
Title: Moving applications to SD card leaves some data behind

history.Text: i have samsung galaxy ace, i have recently rooted my phone and now i can move the apps to the sd card, however it does not seems much happy news for me, as when i move the app to the sd card, some footprints of the app still remain on the internal memory, say for example recently i downloaded the app, whose total memory was 5mb, after moving it to sdcard, internal memory still have 3mb, is it possible to move the app completely in the sdcard. so that i can enjoy the my phone at its best, as i have 8gb of external memory.
Moving applications to sdcard on samsung galaxy ace
